body.p: I have received a line from Mr Henry M. Parker of Boston Mass, requesting me to ask for him a commission to take depositions acknowledgements &c in that state to be used in this

Mr Parker is a lawyer of high standing, and a man of honor and integrity: in "politics" if the word expressses the views of a man in this tremendous juncture of affairs, an old Clay Whig who deplores all the radical acts of the present administration, but not ready to turn traitor to his country.

If you can send me a commission for him
as above suggested consistently with the public service I shall esteem it as a great favor, which I will reciprocate when I get to be secretary of state_and long before when opportunity may offer

Massachusetts
Comr of Deeds
H. M. Parker
Boston
Com Issd Mar 6. 1863.
